Docs.summary: Specifies authentication properties for the peer certificate.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the certificate validation mode.
Docs.value: A value from the enumeration in .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::IdentityModel::Selectors::X509CertificateValidator ^ CustomCertificateValidator { System::IdentityModel::Selectors::X509CertificateValidator ^ get(); void set(System::IdentityModel::Selectors::X509CertificateValidator ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a custom client certificate validator.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) provides a default client certificate validator that verifies the client certificate against the trusted people store and also checks that the certificate chains up to a valid root. A custom validator can be implemented to obtain a different behavior. This property allows a custom validator to be specified.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509RevocationMode RevocationMode { System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509RevocationMode get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509RevocationMode value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the certificate revocation mode.
Docs.value: One of the values in : , , or .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When using certificates, the system validates that the client certificate has not been revoked, by checking that the client certificate is not in the revoked certificate list. This check can be performed either by checking online or by checking against a cached revocation list. Revocation checking can be turned off by setting this property to NoCheck.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::StoreLocation TrustedStoreLocation { System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::StoreLocation get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::StoreLocation value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the trusted store location where the client certificate is validated.
Docs.value: The trusted store location where the client certificate is validated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When using certificates, Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) security system validates the client certificate against a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.StoreLocation>. The store location is specified using this parameter.
